website_summaries.verdict: This basic hydration reservoir gets the job done.
pros: Reservoir made of thick TPU anti-bacterial material
cons: Cap can be difficult to screw on squarely

customer_reviews.title: Some people said that it made the water taste like plastic (go figure its made from plastic)
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before I bought this item. Some people said that it made the water taste like plastic (go figure its made from plastic). SOOOOO to fix that I filled it with water and added about 1 tablespoon of white vinegar and let it sit for a day or so. I also attached the drinking hose and filled it with the water/vinegar too. I Cycled the water through the hose about 5 times the first day. When I used it for a backpacking trip my water tasted fine :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Beyond expectation!! Great Product!! Great Price!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a replacement for your camel back bladder look no further! Way worth it! Great replacement bladder and very effective cleaning tools. The drying rack works perfect and the best part is the quick connect hose! Superb kit for the price. Responsive seller/creator! Email answered almost immediately and respectfully! Definitely worth every penny (and probably more)! Thanks Sport Trail!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality hydration bladder
customer_reviews.text: The 2L SportsTrail Hydration Bladder is really nice. It's made of quality materials that will hold up to multiple uses. The mouthpiece is easy to use and gives a good water flow. I rinsed the bladder and tubing but still had a little plastic taste but better then my other bladder I have. The tubing attaches and detaches easily. The top is a bit trickier, the top folds over only one direction for the clip to slide on but once you have that figured out it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the handicapped
customer_reviews.text: I use the Sportstrail hydration system as my water source since I have limited use of my hands. I have attached it to an iPad holder on my wheelchair, and have another one beside my bed. The mouthpiece works in every direction, so it’s easy for me to alignment with my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain man

customer_reviews.title: All in one!
customer_reviews.text: Larger opening for filling, detachable hose, cleaning kit, super value! MUCH better quality than the bladder my pack came with!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G.

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement Bladder
customer_reviews.text: Works well. This was a replacement for an old and leaky CamelBak bladder. We did have to cut the mouthpiece to create an opening. SportsTrail did send us an email that this sometimes happens, but we didn't receive t he email until a few days after we had already received the bladder. The cap seals well (no leaking at all), but you have to make sure that you screw it on squarely. If you secure it quickly, it can easily not seal perfectly, and it will then leak. Small things, but be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a 5 star product if it weren't for the lingering plastic taste. Rinsed it out with hot tap water and a little dish soap upon receiving. Still had a strong taste the first time I used it. Taste has gotten weaker each consecutive time I've refilled it, but there is still a slight taste even after a week of daily use. Everything else works as expected and they are much easier to fill and clean than the style with the screw in opening.
customer_reviews.author: MikeBoyle

customer_reviews.title: Mouth piece drips
customer_reviews.text: I am a regular hiker so a new bladder is necessary every few years. I liked that this came with a cleaning kit I’ve used the bladder three times. The first 2 times there was a slow leak from the mouth piece. I’ve tightened the mouth piece by screwing it in more (that did nothing) but that is not the problem. The piece stops leaking when you shut the valve each time. Although this is a hassle, it did correct the problem. I’m hoping that it will eventually self seal. I tried replacing the valve mouth piece with my old one but I cannot remove it as it’s screwed tightly into the tube. This also makes cleaning this part impossible.
customer_reviews.author: chicdesigner

customer_reviews.title: Best hydration pack I’ve ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve hiked a lot in my life and gone through my fair share of hydration packs. A lot of them tend to have all kinds of issues but this is the first one where I can tell the company has taken into account what backpackers and hikers need on a long hike. It holds a ton of water and is so easy to clean and use! I got the cleaning pack with it and it’s amazing. Definitely my favorite hydration pack thus far and will be buying more from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Hanger doesn't fit  current Camelback  reservoir.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mainly for the collapsible hanger. It is a good quality product. Does not fit current Camelback brand reservoir very well. Where the hanger comes out of reservoir opening you have to bend the opening to hang it, which will eventually deform the opening. Should have bought Camelback brand. Rest of the kit seems to be good. I have used Camelback brand for 30 years because they are great reservoirs that don't get dirty inside for years if drained well after using. Need to make sure reservoir you have will work with hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Motomike

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another bladder from another hydration pack brand. The hose is a bit long, but what can you expect from different brands. I trust Camelbak...just didn't want to pay the price for their hydration packs which seem to have skyrocketed since the last time I bought one. So get one of their bladders and insert it into another hydration pack. Works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Non working tube & leaky bag
customer_reviews.text: Water tube did not deliver water to the mouthpiece no matter how many different times/ways I tried to connect, use control valve or amount of suction applied. The bladder also came with a pin hole in the bladder so it was leaking before getting used once. And the bladder was very thin for outdoor recreational use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fitzer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this as a good alternative to an official camelback ...
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a new water bladder for my new hiking backpack when I found this product and decided to pull the trigger. Before my hiking trip, I washed the bladder and hose out with warm water and then let it dry with the included drying hook. I had no issues with plastic tasting water and no leaks over a 10 day period using this bladder. I would recommend this as a good alternative to an official camelback bladder. I will be buying another in the future for my wife's backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle & Emily

customer_reviews.title: It fills it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: I've used my purchase a handful of times since I purchased it and it's OK. I'm using it as a replacement for my Nathan hydration pack. My old bladder cracked and I needed a new one. The Nathan replacement cost about $70, where this was about $15. It fits into my hydration pack and holds/dispenses water as expected. Yes after multiple washes it still has a slight plastic taste but it hadn't bothered me during my 7+ mile runs. Washing it isn't as easy either because it can't be turned inside out like my Nathan bladder due to a plastic membrane connection inside. So as I stated in my headline for $15 it fulfills my need.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set up and great value.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once and I love that it does not taste like plastic. I did have and issue with the opening on the mouthpiece but that was easily fixed opening it with my finger nail. I love the fact it has a cleaning kit as that had worried me about my old one that was a hand me down from a military pack and the water tasted very much like plastic. I love not having to lug around water bottles and the fact that water is readily available when we are backpacking and I just want a quick drink.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bladder to replace my old nasty Camel Back bladder. This one is offered at a great price. It appears to be good quality and functions as expected. My only minor gripe is the lid attachment. It is a tether with a small ball that fits into a groove on the hard plastic part of the bladder. Bit does not stay in very well, after the lid is unscrewed and dangling; it falls out. Not a big deal, just kind of annoying. Other than that, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This was a dual use purchase for me and it was perfect. I needed the cleaning pieces for an old hydration bladder that I put away poorly and grew mold. The bladder itself I turned into a feed sack for a gravity filter setup. The cleaning set worked great and the drying frame allowed the bag to dry completely. All in all, great deal and I knocked out 2 projects with one purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hobo

customer_reviews.title: Great Hydration Bladder!  Great for hikes!!
customer_reviews.text: My niece chewed up the mouth piece on my other hydration bladder so I had to hurry up and find a replacement. I found this one and like it better than the Eddie Bauer one I have too. Very easy to clean and put water in bladder. I used washing direction when I first got item and have not had a problem with plastic tasting water. It just needs a good cleaning with vinager and water!
customer_reviews.author: Shyra SB

customer_reviews.title: Future Marine needs dependable bladder. ;)
customer_reviews.text: My son is heading for the Marines next month. He works out with other Marines now and it's HOT here in CA. His camelback bladder busted from another seller. I read tons of reviews and decided on this one. I received it and gave it to my son and he had it replaced and working in minutes. Works great! My son is 18 and 6'4" and very athletic, he needs his water bladder to be very dependable. We're happy with our purchase. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Kimber Fraser

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Talking performance for price, this is a tough bladder to beat. The cleaning kit is fine and it is almost like getting the bladder for free. (though I shortened the delivery hose an inch so the flexi-brush could exit) I follow instructions and rinse with warm water before use and the resulting taste is no worse than any other canteen system. I have no complaints...not for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Usr NeXT

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving this 4 stars because all the supplies that ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 4 stars because all the supplies that come with the bladder are really helpful. My main problem has been that the larger opening is hard to seal tightly. I thought I'd had it lined up properly a couple times and couldn't rotate the door any further, but it still wasn't sealed and I spilled water everywhere from it at least twice. Eventually, it seems to seal, but takes some work to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. We have used it twice and it started leaking all over our bags. It is of course outside the warranty period and the company is not responding so we have no option but to buy another from a brand we recognize.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: No complaints for my Hydration needs
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 of them on a day trip, His and hers bags, and we treated them to a hot water flush before filling with water. No taste at all. I think I want to try adding a sock of some sort that blocks out the sunlight from the tube because the first sips out of the line are warm, probably due to heating up in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Tararug

customer_reviews.title: Nice little kit
customer_reviews.text: Nice little kit. The long brush fit my disgusting, mold-filled tube nicely, and after successively pulling it through about 5 times, now my tube is clean! Little brush fits the mouthpiece, medium sized one fits inside the bladder. Everything is now hanging with the plastic piece inserted drying (after about 6 rinses). Extremely handy, and all the right stuff. Photo attached of the clean tube; had I been firing on all cylinders, I'd had a picture of the dirty tube for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: Hello What can I say......... it is a really useful product for everyone who uses hydration bags. If something is annoying is to see how the bag is getting dirty and filled with fungus and mold. And not having the right tools for your cleaning, it simply forces you to discard it. So I made an excellent purchase and the product meets my expectations ..... Thanks Sinsely Luis E. Espinoza, SV
customer_reviews.author: Luis Ernesto Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Perfect companion
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our longer hiking trails. This kit is awesome as it comes with everything you need to take care of the product without needing to find a separate kit just for cleaning supplies. It fit perfectly into my day pack. Not completely unexpected, at first the water tasted slightly plasticky. However, after a few washes and use it went away.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse J

customer_reviews.title: Love the accessories
customer_reviews.text: I got this due to letting my original camel back bladder get gross. I love the quick release for the straw and cleaning supplies and hanger that comes with it. The only reason I didn’t rare it a 5 is because I thought it was going to be a perfect replacement for my camelback one but it is shaped differently so doesn’t fit as well into my camelback aurora. But it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Xena

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra $15 and get a name brand!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these bladders, one for my mom and one for myself. BOTH OF THEM LEAK OVER 66.6% OF THE TIME!!!!. I've had had a couple of other hydration bladders over the years but unfortunately these have been by far the worst. Its really a shame because they seem to be made of good material and they are at a smoking price. But if I grab my pack and its soaked through. Or if I'm abroad on a shuttle to the trail head and all of the sudden I feel drops of water overhead and all my gear is wet I get really annoyed because half of my hike is uncomfortable. DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pinhole leak in side of bladder
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this bladder it was raining, so when I felt some water dripping down my back I attributed it to the rain. However, I later discovered there was a small hole toward the top of the bladder. It constantly leaks and I haven't been able to get a patch to stick. If it weren't for the hole, it would be a perfect product. With the hole, I'm worried about not having enough water for long runs on hot days.
customer_reviews.author: Scimmian

customer_reviews.title: Clean straws/drinking tubes! YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: We cleaned two different models of Camelbaks with this kit, and the brushes worked perfectly! The dry rack only works for the large opening one, but they both got clean:) The long brush is great for water bottle straws as well. Very satisfied with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Opinionated2

customer_reviews.title: Poor design quality
customer_reviews.text: The quick disconnect tends to separate slightly while riding which causes issues with pulling water through the bite valve. The large full cap is also VERY difficult to tighten. I had an original Camelbak bladder prior to this with absolutely no issues. My hats off to these guys for trying to compete with a cheaper alternative but the tube quick connect and full cap designs need to be revised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for daily users.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Significantly cheaper than name brand, but less than two months in and it's already leaking from the cap. At the time I bought I thought I was getting a good deal for the money spent, but now I have to adjust the fill to make sure it doesn't leak into my backpack. Will not buy again, and will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Ashley

customer_reviews.title: So I use my water bottle for something different then It is intended for but it is very important to me now I am glad this one has the cleaning kit
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the water bladder was in 2008 when I did a rim to rim hike at the Grand Canyon. 2 months later I fell and broke my neck and have a spinal cord injury. Now I am paralyzed from my shoulders down. At night my caregiver puts my water bladder on my bed so when I am thirsty during the tonight I can get a drink without bothering anyone. So I use my water bottle for something different then It is intended for but it is very important to me now I am glad this one has the cleaning kit.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Kohl

customer_reviews.title: Great Hydration Bladder
customer_reviews.text: I love the hose connection to the bladder which makes it easy to disassemble and clean. I also had the misfortune to have my first delivery stolen when the mail service left it on the ground under my mailbox. When the manufacturer learned of the loss, they provided me detailed information on how to deal with Amazon to get a refund. I got an immediate refund and reordered the bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Robust and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and wonderful water pack, super tough. I bought this bladder because I was needing it for a paintball big game, I had this bladder on my vest and I ran rolled and hit my back against when stopping myself when dashing. I put my weight and more on my back, directly pressing up against the bladder and it did not just, it's wonderful and durable, I would recommend to anyone if you're looking for a bladder replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JCAR

customer_reviews.title: and also followed up to be sure I liked the product
customer_reviews.text: This kit is a must-have! The brushes fit every cranny of my Camelbak, allowing me to get it really clean and ready for my next adventure. Thoughtful seller sent instructions after my purchase, and also followed up to be sure I liked the product. Fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Yeatsian1

customer_reviews.title: Great setup, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great setup, great price. I have a camelback bag that's a few years old and this new one performs as well. Even better, it has a sealed disconnect so the hose can be removed for cleaning. It comes with a long brush that extends the length of the tube, and a frame to keep the bag open for drying. All that at an affordable price, what else do you want?
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend if you own a back-pack reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Did the job, just as described. My daughter came back from camp where she had been using her Osprey backpack with a Hydrapak reservoir, which unfortunately she'd left unused (but still wet) for a few days. It had a deep yellow (mold?) stain in part of the tubing. We were able to use this kit to clean not only the tube, but all the other parts of the reservoir and tubing system quite easily. A few days after receiving the kit I got an email from founder of the company with simple usage instructions; more than you'd expect for a relatively inexpensive item. Just one more thing to like about this. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FGNY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect--my husband had a hydration pack in which the bladder always leaked, but he never did anything about it until after the warranty period had expired, so I got this one for him, and it fits and works perfectly. I especially like that this came with the cleaning brushes and rack to dry it out, so it doesn't get all nasty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great generic pack bladder!
customer_reviews.text: This hydration bladder is amazing. It seals well, has a great quick connect on the hose. The opening on the top may seem shifty but it is very secure and does not leak, nothing leaks, its great. I bought this for a generic hydration pack and it fit wonderfully, I replaced a previous 2l bladder with another 2l bladder and I love this new one, great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Clark

customer_reviews.title: Bite Valves Leaks :(
customer_reviews.text: The bladder itself is pretty solid, I like how it closes at the top instead of the screw top other bladders have makes it easier to fill. My only issues are that after a couple uses the bite valve started to leak. Also, the cap snapped off after just a couple uses. For the price it’s ok if you’re not gonna use this for daily running, would likely be better used for hiking where you could be more gentle on the cap.
customer_reviews.author: GotJoeks5

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine so am happy with it after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2L bladder in the fall of 2017. I struggled with the closure when I needed the full 2L. I contacted the company and their customer service was outstanding! They said they redesigned the closure to be similar to the Camelback. They offered to send me a new bladder which I received within days. The time from initial query until I had a new bladder in my hand was under a week. The closure is much easier to seal than their old design. I have used it without difficulty. That level of customer service is rare. I will buy another product from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: martha n.

customer_reviews.title: Great bladder & cleaning kit!
customer_reviews.text: This bladder is great and I really appreciate the cleaning kit. After several years using my old bladder it had to go it was getting rather...well it had to go. There is really no good way to clean these and get them completely dry until now. The little extra's that come with this bladder make a huge difference. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: This was the best thing I packed for my 13-mile RT day hike
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this hydration reservoir for a recent trip to Saguaro National Park. This was the best thing I packed for my 13-mile RT day hike. The 2L size was great - I had water to keep me going all day. My hiking buddy brought a very similar CamelBack reservoir...aside from the price tag, you'd never know the difference. I also appreciate the special cleaning and drying equipment it came with. Great purchase. Plan to buy another one for my husband.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Best To Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Tastes like delicious cancer! The 'flavoring' never quite goes away. I couldn't find any statements of whether or not it's BPA-Free. I tried multi-day soaks, soaps, tons of rinsing, but nope it just didn't get it done. In the end, a premium bladder with none of the issues doesn't cost that much more.
customer_reviews.author: Blik

customer_reviews.title: No.
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to get any water out. The point of these things is supposed to be able to drink water easily while doing an activity simultaneously. But instead I have to stop what I’m doing to use all my energy trying to suck the tiniest bit of water out of this thing. 😑😑
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product with one tiny caveat.
customer_reviews.text: Quality items. Bite valve works great and all components were easy to handle and clean. Zero plastic taste. Only complaint it that the screw on lid is hard to screw on. Requires precision which is extra challenging while the bladder has water. I didn't feel that it had closed completely, but was too frustrated to continue trying. It did not, however, leak even a drop.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Worthless! Leaked after less than 5 uses!
customer_reviews.text: - It leaked after less than 5 uses. I had used it as a hydration bladder for a Nathan Vapor Air Hydration vest. - It leaked and put my running liquids onto my back. Ruined my day and I was lucky I was training and not in an actual race. - Would not recommend it. Worthless!
customer_reviews.author: iluvgr8tdealsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: Best design. The opening at the top allows for ease of loading ice. And with the plastic protecting the bag, the closure slides easily on unlike other models which get tougher the older they get
customer_reviews.author: John C. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking, but be sure to soak
customer_reviews.text: This is a great package with everything you could possibly need in it. Just be sure to soak the bladder in warm water like... 5 or 6 times overnight to get that plastic taste out. It works perfectly though, especially once we got rid of that odd taste.
customer_reviews.author: S Tia

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Others that spent a lot more than me had leak issues with their water storage products. I had no such issue. 8 miles of hiking with this mostly tethered to the outside of my bag with no issues. That’s probably not the opportune way of carrying it but zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Titus Roybal

customer_reviews.title: Good bladder bag.
customer_reviews.text: Four stars because the mouth piece is a little difficult to use. Other than that this is as good as any bladder out there. I read reviews where people said the lid was difficult or it leaked on them. I think those people are just to dumb to do it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: rockabillybanger

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated with lid and water acquires plastic taste.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a dozen times over the past 6 months and have finally given up with frustration. The screw lid is very hard to attach and constantly falls off the leash (and into the dirt) when filling. After about 30 minutes the water acquires a nasty plastic taste. It’s cheap and you get what you pay for. On the positive side, the bladder is very sturdy and the cleaning kit effective. That said, I'm back to buy a different brand so I can throw this one away.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mauvais

customer_reviews.title: For short term use only
customer_reviews.text: I got this almost exactly a year ago, and I’ve been careful about cleaning and storing. Tried to use it recently and the connector for the hose straw leaks all over the place. Very frustrating- I was hoping this would last longer than a year. I don’t recommend this bladder for the price.
customer_reviews.author: nunya.business

customer_reviews.title: Hard to seal and failed almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an overseas hiking trip. The seal was very hard to make after I filled it.. and then on one of the first uses, it started leaking though a tiny slit near the filling hole. I was stuck! I ended up putting tape over the place where it leaked and used it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen  Pomerantz

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's made for!
customer_reviews.text: Needs to be given a vinegar rinse each time you're going to use it or the water tastes horrible! It IS easy to disassemble and clean, but BE CAREFUL that you don't pull too hard on the mouthpiece while you're hiking. If you dislodge the rubber seal, you'll be a leaky hot mess who looks like (s)he's ready for a wet t-shirt contest.
customer_reviews.author: CourtCourt

customer_reviews.title: Best festival hydration bladder
customer_reviews.text: This was a super easy bladder to open and fill at a hydration station at a summer festival I went to. Its a very rushed environment and so being efficient and quick as possible is my goal. I would recommend this bladder to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately the water from the bladder does still taste like plastic after a few hours in the bladder
customer_reviews.text: This bladder is well-constructed, no leaking and the tubing feels well-constructed. Materials feel high quality. I have used this bladder 3 times and have had no problems. Unfortunately the water from the bladder does still taste like plastic after a few hours in the bladder. Not as overwhelming as some other bladders I have used, but still noticeable. Overall I would say this is still a good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great choice for me needing a new bladder! I put it in my small pack I use for hiking and mountain biking and this was better than my original. Used it in consecutive days out biking and cleaned it out and was dry and ready to go on day two! The valves work great no drips and kept me going on a 13 mile trial ride in the mountains of East Tennessee!
customer_reviews.author: Frankie71

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. One broke first use. Second one broke short time later. Both are REALLY poorly designed at the spot where the mouthpiece locks the liquid inside. Terrible quality product.
customer_reviews.author: BeePositive

customer_reviews.title: Gets it clean
customer_reviews.text: Awesome to clean some bladder hoses that were sitting in the garage for years getting moldy. This cloned it all so well and love the hanger dryer part!
customer_reviews.author: KarateKids916

customer_reviews.title: A+ Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great cleaning tools, great product overall. The two things that could be improved are the lid--it's not hard to close, but you should double check after screwing it in to make sure it's closed fully and correctly--and attaching the tubing to the bladder can take some finagling sometimes. Overall I think it's well worth the price and seems like a high quality bladder.
customer_reviews.author: OneLoveUSC

customer_reviews.title: Leaked/defective product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bladder and it started leaking after the 2nd time using it and caused me to run out of water while hiking, luckily my friends had extra but seems like it could be dangerous for people if they buy this and start leaking water alone in the desert.
customer_reviews.author: B-Mo

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement bladder
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an OLD Blackburn bladder system. It works better than the original as far as I can tell. No flavor to speak of, and the included cleaning kit is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the components of this bladder (quick connect, shut-off valve, wide mouth, cleaning tools, etc.), but after one use, it developed a pinhole leak in the seam where the lid connects. Not discernable when filled and getting loaded up, but once my pack was on and there was a little pressure on the pack ... here comes the rain. Unknowingly lost about 2/3 of a liter on a long hike and had to struggle through the last couple of miles with no water left in the tank. Made for a very unpleasant experience for me. Tread with caution when buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Roderick

customer_reviews.title: Smells and leaks
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these, and one of them is defective and always leaks. They also make the water taste like plastic no matter how well you clean them, or how long they air out.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't seal well, I used it once and it had a small leak around the opening where you fill it, but wasn't too bad. After trying to use it a 2nd time, the plastic mouthpiece fell entirely off and cant be put back together, making the bladder useless.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Does not close securely.
customer_reviews.text: Completely inadequate. I've used a Camelback and a Platypus for years, and am familiar with hour hydration bladders work. After ten minutes of fussing with it at the kitchen sink, I was unable to get the filling lid to close properly. I don't doubt that given enough time and trial and error, it would be possible to occasionally seal it properly. But it's certainly not the sort of thing I'd want to rely on in the backcounty, or even with my pack sitting in the trunk of my car. There are FAR better options than this. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: NWSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Product Delivered, Labeled As Described Here.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong product delivered. If it had looked like the pictures here, I am certain I would have been happy. In fact, the contents had the label matching the description of this item on Amazon. But it was a bag with arm-straps (and a reservoir built into it) but not just the reservoir, which is what I thought I was buying.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: excellent bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Just a well thought out, excellent bit of kit. The seller even contacted me through email before receiving the item, giving me plenty of great tips on maintenance and getting the most out of the product. Really a nice touch, considering this is my first bladder, and it won't be my last from this seller. Worked great to keep me hydrated and cooled down during a hot day playing paintball.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Great and very. Useful
customer_reviews.text: This is really great. Helped me to carry the religious water from the religious Lake Manas Sarovar 18000 feet above the Sea Level, thousands of miles, Crossed countries like Nepal, China & Qatar in the suit case. No trouble
customer_reviews.author: QueenLeo36

customer_reviews.title: 60 day warranty, are you kidding me
customer_reviews.text: This comes with a 60 day warranty. That should tell you all you need to know. It's crap. I've used mine 3 times, and it is leaking from the very bottom of the bag. Poor quality, poor contruction
customer_reviews.author: Vince Pachiano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement Bladder
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement for a leaking bladder. This was not only cheaper than my original replacement but came with all the accessories for cleaning. I like that the hose is detachable, makes it easier for cleaning and drying out. I really like the "on/off" for drinking. My only complaint is that the hose is a little short.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjeev

customer_reviews.title: Non functional
customer_reviews.text: The gasket leaked and the mouthpiece had no opening, Which sort of defeats the purpose. I would have returned it but ended up using the handy cleaning tool to clean of the original Camelback bag I was planning to replace.
customer_reviews.author: musiclover2000

customer_reviews.title: Leaked inside my backpack after just a few uses. ...
customer_reviews.text: Leaked inside my backpack after just a few uses. The seal is difficult to get right and even with patience and caution, I still had it leak. It worked well most of the times I used it, but I can't risk soaking all my gear. Once was enough. Only going to use it on minimal day hikes with light gear (now in sealed plastic bags).
customer_reviews.author: AlanV

customer_reviews.title: functional is all
customer_reviews.text: It's just alright. It's functional. The mouth piece didn't work at all and I didn't even want to mess with it, so I just put my old mouthpiece that's much better anyway on it and it's fin. The cleaning kit is cool and is probably the only reason i didn't return it. Sometimes you just get what you pay for............oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian RN

customer_reviews.title: Don't think twice, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Osprey day pack that had a pocket for bladders. Couldn't be happier. There are many of these on Amazon, but this one is a great value, works fantastically, and includes cleaning equipment (if you've ever tried to clean one of these, you'll realize how hard that is without specialized equipment!). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Long

customer_reviews.title: Better thany Camelbak
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hydration pack! Had an issue with my hose and contacted their customer service, the issue was resolved immediately and I was extremely impressed. I regularly used CamelBak and I like these better because I couldn't stand the Camelbak design of the twist shut plate for closing the pack, the slide on these is much less messy to close. All around awesome! Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly as described and arrived on time. The thing that really struck me is the personal communication from the owner. It was a prompt reply to a question I had. The product is solid and better than you'd expect for the price. First time out I fell while running and landed on the pack holding the bladder. Not one bit of damage. Not one drop of water leaked. All in all I was extremely impressed with the product and the company. I'd buy from this owner again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like the mouthpiece was defective, as reported by others, however after squeezing it a few times it finally opened up. Other than that, it seems to work just fine and is a nice replacement for my old bladder which got to tasting pretty bad after I put a new hose on it from the big home store.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gehring

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have a bladder that doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bladder twice now. I had some trouble getting the water to come out, but figured out to turn the mouthpiece (not the shutoff valve) and water finally flowed freely. Also have had some trouble closing the cap in the bladder. It's getting easier with each use. Happy to have a bladder that doesn't leak!
customer_reviews.author: Sue E. Wetterlin

customer_reviews.title: Slide closure is difficult but overall quality is good
customer_reviews.text: I've had a number of hydration bladders over the years. This one has very good build quality. Taste of water is good. Bite valve is decent and bite valve cover is nice if protecting the valve from dirt is important to you. The only issue is the top closure slider is difficult to slide on and off. I have strong hands and I can see this being very difficult for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Kozlowski

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a pin-hole leak
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with a pin-hole leak in the body of the bag. Water spurted out of the hole the first time I filled it and gave it a little squeeze. Returning it for a genuine Camelbak. If it wasn't for the hole, I'd say it appears to be well made, and I appreciate the brushes and hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Holly A. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Leaked from day one....ruined stuff and had NO water when I needed it!!!! 😣
customer_reviews.text: Great idea...but leaks everywhere so when I want a drink during 5 hours of Turtle tracking in 94 degree weather, very disappointed that I had NO water, but it leaked EVERYWHERE and ruined stuff in my backpack....
customer_reviews.author: Terri Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I have been using for the past ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have been using for the past week. Bought it for a trip to India, and it certainly has come in clutch. The owner of this company has also been fantastic with follow up and making sure that I am satisfied with the product. Works well with my Osprey travel porter 46 bag and Daylite plus as well, and I would imagine is compatible with most such bags. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O'Rourke

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: The mouthpiece leaks nonstop. I purchased it for my son. He did not tell me it was leaking until it had grown progressive worse. By then, it was too late to return it. He likes the brushes, but get frustrated when the hanger gadget doesn't stay open to allow the bladder to dry completely.
customer_reviews.author: blessedw2

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I love that it holds my source hydration bladder upside down and my straw tub straight so it can all drain completely
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this sooner! If you have a water pack you know how bad they can get. I would try to wash it and it never tasted right. This new one is so nice! My only complaint is that it taste a bit plasticity, its getting better with each refill.
customer_reviews.author: Chris's Library

customer_reviews.title: Buy now!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!! And this company. Best price and prefect set up. Shipped super fast. It's great the it comes with a cleaning brush. Used it on a snowboarding trip, and I was blown away how well it fit and worked. Also I wish I could give them more stars due amazing customer service!! Ziga is very sweet and cares about her customers!!! If you need a water bladder don't look anywhere else. Buy this one! 10/10 :)
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: The top leaks no matter how I twist the top on.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for obvious reasons and the product seemed to be good quality when I got it. I used it to go hiking and it leaked out of the main screw top compartment onto my back and neck every time I leaned over. I tried retwisting the top on multiple times and I think the seal is just messed up. Every thing else worked great but I was very disappointed that when I got to the end of the trail and very thirsty and realized I had no water left due to all the spilling. Will not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. First bladder came with a mouthpiece that didn't qork properly but they are super quick in getting a new one out to me ahead of a racw it was purchased for. New one works great! Great product, OUTSTANDING customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Cory Hedstrom

customer_reviews.title: Mouth piece leaks
customer_reviews.text: I've had the product for about a month now. The end cap of the mouth piece has already broken off. Since day one the mouth piece has let air in when closed. Now it leaks and will drain the entire tube of water if left filled. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: ... hydration pack works in a pinch and doesn't taste bad (like some of they do at first) My biggest ...
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack works in a pinch and doesn't taste bad (like some of they do at first) My biggest trouble with it- and why I can't give it 5 stars, is that it's really hard to correctly close. if the top is off by just a little bit I can't get it to close and not leak. It takes a bit of time at the beginning of a hike to get it properly set up before I can head out... which is kind of annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for letting me know any hints on the above question
customer_reviews.text: I am just wondering the best way to get the taste of rubber out of the bladder. I am just wondering the best way to get the taste of rubber out of the bladder I have used several other platters and none of them have such an extreme ever taste. I am cleaning it out with warm water but that is all I know to do and not sure that is going to do the trick
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow Call

customer_reviews.title: Good overall product. Lid closes hard, though
customer_reviews.text: Really like the quick connect for the water hose. Sure beats my old one that screwed in. Also like the mouthpiece - very easy to drink from. My only complain so far is that the closure lid is difficult to get lined up correctly and secured in place when the bladder is full. But in all fairness, I have only used it once, so it might just take some getting used to. Very good quality product from what I can see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A major disappointment. Returning it forthwith
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of not carefully reading all of the reviews. I cannot close the filler hole lid after fooling around with it for at least 20 minutes. A nonstarter. Additionally the mouthpiece is not working correctly. A major disappointment. Returning it forthwith.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndy T

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Bladder, Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived on time, and it was just as the seller had described it. It was easy to use, and comes with what you need to properly care for the product. I would surely buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa E.

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to disassemble and clean
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use when my son and I go backpacking with the scouts. So far, nothing problematic. It is easy to disassemble and clean. The drying hooks (2-pack) work great and the size is enough water for a good overnight.
customer_reviews.author: K CTop Contributor: Fantasy Books

customer_reviews.title: Sanitizing drinking tube is essential!
customer_reviews.text: All items work as expected. Much better to have a kit than piecemealing misc. items for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: MotoCampKelly

customer_reviews.title: Just as Described
customer_reviews.text: I really like the material it is made with. The bladders that I have had previously did not feel nearly as thick as this one. The description advertises tasteless and odorless. This was definitely not false. I am very sensitive to the way that different waters taste and my last hydration bladder made the water taste so much like plastic that it was very hard to drink. This bladder lasted all night with no change in taste to the water that was in it. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Hydration Bladder 2 Liter, 1.5 & 3 Liter Water Bladder, Leak Proof Water Reservoir, Tasteless BPA-Free Military Water Storage Bladder Bag Hiking Climbing Cycling
feature_bullets: PREMIUM QUALITY - Hydration bladder replacement is made of premium anti-bacteria TPU material. Water bag is taste free, odorless, and BPA free. Our hydration packs passed the pneumatic pressure test, 24-hour swing test and 24-hour vibration test. It is completely pressure-tolerant and leak proof for carefree biking, running, hiking and other outdoor adventures!

LARGE OPENING & ATTACHED HEAD PULLER - Big opening on the top (5 inches) is perfect for filling camel bag with water, ice cubes, different sports drinks and it makes cleaning and drying super easy. For cold water, simply add ice cubes directly from a scoop or refrigerator ice dispenser. Backpack water bladder has head puller attached to the bladder, so you will never have to worry about losing or misplacing it.

QUICK RELEASE TUBE WITH SHUTOFF VALVE - Our hydration bladder military has quick release auto-lock system that prevents leaking when the tube is detached and allows the tube to be easily disconnected from Hydration reservoir for filling, cleaning, and storage. Soft bite mouthpiece with pull-out shutoff valve provides fast water flow.

STAY LIGHT & BALANCED WHILE ON THE MOVE - No more water bottles! Lightweight, hands-free water storage bladder bag improves balance with center baffle for a hydration pack bladder. Slim profile hydration water bladder loads quickly into your hiking or camping backpack.

MONEY BACK GUARANTEE - You can buy with confidence because we want your 100% satisfaction. If camel pack bladder did not meet your expectations or if you need a replacement, please do not hesitate to contact us. We are here for you!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
